'''Rían''' means "Crown-gift" in [[Sindarin]] (from ''[[rî]]'', "crown, garland" and ''[[ann]]'', "gift"), and can refer to:

== Middle-earth ==
* '''[[Rían]] ({{FA|450}} - {{FA|472}}), wife of [[Huor]] and mother of [[Tuor]]'''
* [[Rían (daughter of Steward Barahir)|Rían]] (fl. c. {{TA|2328}}), daughter of [[Ruling Steward]] [[Barahir (Steward of Gondor)|Barahir]] of [[Gondor]]

== Adaptations ==
* [[Rían (Kip Chapman)|Rían]], a character invented for season one of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]''.
* [[Rían (Selina Lo)|Rían]], a character invented for season two of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]''.
